required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effect of two different maintenance doses of Symbicort Maintenance And Reliever Therapy (SMART) in adult asthmatic patients. A 6 month treatment period

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Severe Asthma Exacerbations Per Participant.
primary_outcome.description: Time to first severe asthma exacerbation, translated to mean number of severe asthma exacerbations per participant. A severe asthma exacerbation is defined as deterioration in asthma requiring oral/systemic glucocorticosteroids for at least 3 days and/or hospitalisation/emergency room visit with oral/systemic glucocorticosteroid treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Fraction of Participants With Severe Asthma Exacerbation
secondary_outcome.description: The total number of severe asthma exacerbations was calculated for each participant. A severe asthma exacerbation is defined as deterioration in asthma requiring oral/systemic glucocorticosteroids for at least 3 days and/or hospitalisation/emergency room visit with oral/systemic glucocorticosteroid treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Total Number of Severe Asthma Exacerbations That Led to Hospitalisation and/or Emergency Room Treatment.
secondary_outcome.description: A severe asthma exacerbation is defined as deterioration in asthma requiring oral/systemic glucocorticosteroids for at least 3 days and/or hospitalisation/emergency room visit with oral/systemic glucocorticosteroid treatment. Number of events per participant

secondary_outcome.measure: Total Number of Days Per Participant With Oral/Systemic Glucocorticosteroids During Severe Asthma Exacerbation
secondary_outcome.description: Total number of days with oral/systemic glucocorticosteroids during severe exacerbation calculated for each participant. A severe asthma exacerbation is defined as deterioration in asthma requiring oral/systemic glucocorticosteroids for at least 3 days and/or hospitalisation/emergency room visit with oral/systemic glucocorticosteroid treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Daily Number of Inhalations of As-needed Medication.
secondary_outcome.description: The number of as-needed inhalations was measured 2 times during 2 weeks before 13 weeks and 26 weeks of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Participants With a Well Controlled Asthma Week.
secondary_outcome.description: The mean percent of participants fulfilling the criteria for a well controlled asthma week in each treatment. A well controlled asthma week is defined as a week with no exacerbations and no night-time awakenings due to asthma and a maximum of 2 days with symptoms and as-needed inhalation use.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Overall Asthma Control Questionnaire (ACQ) Score
secondary_outcome.description: The ACQ5 was used. The lower value the better with a full range from 0=no impairment, 6= maximum impairment. Awakenings, morning symptoms, limitations, shortness of breath and wheeze.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Mean Total Daily Dose of Steroids From Symbicort.
secondary_outcome.description: The mean total daily dose of steroids from Symbicort was calculated as the sum of the maintenance dose and the as-needed dose.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Cost Per Participant Per Country
secondary_outcome.description: Mean cost is calculated for each country using participants from the whole study and country specific costs. Mean value for the whole study can not be calculated.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients at out-patient clinics
- >18 years with a minimum of 6 months documented history of persistent asthma who have used inhaled glucocorticosteroids for at least one month and have a history of use in rapid-acting B2 agonists for symptom relief
Exclusion Criteria:
- Asthma exacerbation within the last 14 days prior to study start
- subject aged >40 years with a smoking history of >10pack-years
- subjects with chronic obstructive lung disease or other significant respiratory disease

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This was a 6-month, randomised, open label, parallel-group, active controlled, multinational study, in participants with uncontrolled/partly controlled asthma, who were symptomatic despite daily use of inhaled glucocorticosteroid (IGCS) with or without Long-Acting β2 agonist (LABA).

group.title: Symbicort® SMART®) 1*2
group.description: 1 inhalation of Symbicort 160µg/4.5µg twice daily plus as-needed.

group.title: Symbicort® SMART®) 2*2
group.description: 2 inhalations of Symbicort 160µg/4.5µg twice daily plus as-needed.

participants_list.participants: 4203 participants randomised. Out of these, 195 had no efficacy data after randomisation.
4221 participants randomised. Out of these, 176 had no efficacy data after randomisation.

group.title: Symbicort® SMART®) 1*2
group.description: 1 inhalation of Symbicort 160µg/4.5µg twice daily plus as-needed.

group.title: Symbicort® SMART®) 2*2
group.description: 2 inhalations of Symbicort 160µg/4.5µg twice daily plus as-needed.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Treatment with Long-Acting β2 agonist (LABA) at baseline.

class.title: Number of participants using LABA at baseline.
Number of participants without LABA at baseline.

measure.title: Asthma control questionnaire (ACQ5) score at study entry
measure.description: ACQ5 was used. The lower value the better with a full range from 0=no impairment, 6= maximum impairment. Awakenings, morning symptoms, limitations, shortness of breath and wheeze.

measure.title: Exacerbations past 12 months before study start.
Inhaled glucocorticosteroids (IGCS) dose at study entry.
Participants with a well controlled asthma week at study entry.
Pulmonary function test at baseline.
measure.description: Peak Expiratory Flow (PEF) was recorded at baseline, the assessment was performed at least 15 minutes after 2 inhalations of Symbicort 160/4.5µg. pn=predicted normal. Symbicort SMART 1*2 arm: n=4001 and Symbicort SMART 2*2 arm: n=4003.
measure.units: Percent of predicted normal value of PEF

outcome.title: Mean Daily Number of Inhalations of As-needed Medication.
outcome.description: The number of as-needed inhalations was measured 2 times during 2 weeks before 13 weeks and 26 weeks of treatment.
outcome.population: Inhalations of as-needed medication recorded by 3880 participants in the Symbicort SMART 1*2 Reporting Group and recorded by 3881 participants in the Symbicort SMART 2*2 Reporting Group

group.title: Symbicort® SMART®) 1*2
group.description: 1 inhalation of Symbicort 160µg/4.5µg twice daily plus as-needed.

outcome.title: Percent of Participants With a Well Controlled Asthma Week.
outcome.description: The mean percent of participants fulfilling the criteria for a well controlled asthma week in each treatment. A well controlled asthma week is defined as a week with no exacerbations and no night-time awakenings due to asthma and a maximum of 2 days with symptoms and as-needed inhalation use.
outcome.population: Data for this measure recorded by 3714 participants in the Symbicort SMART 1*2 Reporting Group and recorded by 3718 participants in the Symbicort SMART 2*2 Reporting Group.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
